intro: Euphrasia carpatica, commonly known as Carpathian eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent dark veins, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia carpatica is valued in herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
